main event: A ground radar observation in Pittsfield, Maine on January 3, 1956, reported a round object 10 times larger than the largest star, with a red outer edge, making erratic movements before disappearing slowly.
interesting points: The object was described as 10 times larger than the largest star with a red outer edge and erratic movements.
The observation lasted for half an hour, providing a substantial duration for the sighting.
No sound, contrails, or clear explanations were reported for the observed object.
The conclusion of the observation was 'Probably Astronomical', leaving the sighting unexplained.
The report was based on ground radar observation, adding to the credibility of the sighting.
sighted object: round object with red outer edge
